messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.
Where am I?
I currently don't have access to your location. Would you like me to try to determine your current location? If so, please enable location services or let me know if you want to proceed.
Go ahead and try it.

messages.name: get_location_service_status
messages.content: False
Location services are currently turned off on your device, so I'm unable to determine your location. Would you like me to help you turn on location services?
Yes, please do.

messages.name: set_location_service_status
messages.content: PermissionError: Location service cannot be turned on in low battery mode

I couldn't turn on location services because your device is currently in low battery mode. Would you like me to turn off low battery mode so I can enable location services and help determine your location?
Yes, please turn off low battery mode.

messages.name: set_low_battery_mode_status
messages.content: None

messages.name: set_location_service_status
messages.content: None
Low battery mode is now turned off, and location services are enabled. Would you like me to retrieve your current location now?
Yes, that would be great.

Location services are now enabled. However, I’ll need either permission to access your location or for you to share your current coordinates if prompted.

If you see a request on your device for location access, please allow it. Otherwise, let me know how you’d like to proceed!
Go ahead, access it.

I currently don’t have direct access to your device’s exact location information. If your device provides coordinates (latitude and longitude), please share them, or you might see a system prompt asking you to grant access—please accept it if prompted.

If you can provide your latitude and longitude, I’ll help you identify where you are. Would you like to share that information?
I can't seem to find them.

No problem! If you’re unsure how to find your coordinates, here are a few ways you might be able to get your location on most devices:

1. Smartphone:
 • Open Google Maps or Apple Maps—usually your location (blue dot) can be tapped to see coordinates.
 • On Google Maps, tap and hold on your location until a red marker appears, swipe up and it should show latitude and longitude.

2. Computer (if available):
 • Go to Google and search “What is my location?”—sometimes it displays coordinates.
 • Visit websites like https://www.latlong.net or https://www.mycurrentlocation.net for an automatic readout.

If you’re unable to get your coordinates, please let me know what type of device you’re using (Android, iPhone, Windows, Mac, etc.), and I can provide step-by-step instructions tailored for your device. Would you like guidance for your specific device?
I'm on an iPhone.

Great! Here are step-by-step instructions to find your current coordinates on an iPhone:

Option 1: Using Apple Maps
1. Open the Apple Maps app.
2. Tap the blue dot that shows your current location.
3. Swipe up on the information panel at the bottom; your latitude and longitude will be displayed.

Option 2: Using Compass App
1. Open the Compass app (it’s installed by default on most iPhones).
2. Your current coordinates (latitude and longitude) will be shown at the bottom of the screen.

Option 3: Using Google Maps
1. Open Google Maps.
2. Tap the blue dot (your current location).
3. A pop-up will appear at the bottom; swipe up to see your coordinates.

Once you have your latitude and longitude, just tell me the numbers, and I’ll help identify your location! If you have any trouble, let me know where you’re getting stuck, and I can help further.
I couldn't find it.

No worries! Let’s try a simplified version using the default Compass app, which is usually the easiest way on an iPhone:

1. On your iPhone, swipe down on the home screen and type “Compass” into the search bar, then open the Compass app.
2. At the bottom of the Compass screen, you should see two numbers labeled as latitude (N/S) and longitude (E/W). They might look something like: 37.7739° N, 122.4312° W.

If you still don’t see it, your iPhone might need location services enabled for the Compass app:

Here’s how to check:
1. Open Settings > Privacy & Security > Location Services.
2. Make sure “Location Services” is turned ON.
3. Scroll down and tap Compass, then select “While Using the App.”

Once the Compass app displays your coordinates, you can share them here and I’ll help you identify your exact location.

If you prefer, I can guide you through a different method or help with screenshots—just let me know what’s easiest for you!
